letters.description: Utilizing the four diagnostic pillars—looking, listening, asking, and touching—to evaluate the patient's physical and energetic state.
Differentiating syndromes based on the Eight Principles and Yin-Yang theory to identify the root cause of the patient's imbalance.
Identifying specific meridian blockages and areas of Qi or Blood stasis within the body's energetic pathways.
Harmonizing the relationships between Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, and Water to restore systemic function across the organ systems.
Implementing herbal medicine and nutritional therapy to replenish Jing and support the vital substances of the body.
Applying acupuncture, moxibustion, or Tui Na to stimulate flow and remove energetic obstructions from the channels.
Developing long-term lifestyle, movement, and seasonal practices to maintain health and prevent future illness.
